#ext-gen1052#: The 'checkbox' field allows a simple yes/no choice
#ext-gen1061#: The 'Color' field, allows you to choose a color from a basic palette.
#ext-gen1073#: The field 'Group of radio buttons' allows to choose an element in a finite list of options.
#ext-gen1082#: The 'Group of check boxes' field allows to choose one or more element in a finite list of options .
#ext-gen1091#: The 'Link to content' field allows you to enter a link to a content
#ext-gen1102#: The 'Link to page' field allows you to enter a link to a page of the site.
#ext-gen1113#: The 'List box' field allows you to choose one or more items in a closed or open list.
#ext-gen1126#: The 'Location' field, allows you to enter an address or geographical coordinates (latitude and longitude). This data can be exploited in mapping blocks.
#ext-gen1137#: The 'Date' field allows you to enter a date.
#ext-gen1151#: The 'Time' field can enter a timeslot, displayed in the form hh: mm.
#ext-gen1165#: The 'Média' field allows to choose a media (audio, video, image, animation, or document) from the DAM.
#ext-gen1178#:
The 'External Media' field relies on the oEmbed (http://oembed.com/) API and allows to display external media from the following sources:

  • YouTube (videos)
    • ,
  • Flickr (photo sharing)
    • ,
  • Vimeo (videos)
  • Poll Everywhere (investigations amp; surveys)
  • My Opera (blogs and photos)
  • SmugMug (photo sharing)
  • SlideShare (sharing presentations)
  • WordPress.com (blogging)
  • chirbit.com (sharing of audio files)
  • CircuitLab (electrical diagram tool)
  • Funtrivia.com (survey tool)
#ext-gen1189#: The 'Number' field, allows you to enter a number, or decimal integer, possibly bounded by upper and lower bounds.
#ext-gen1204#: The 'Slider' field allows you to enter an integer between two limits, using a slider.
#ext-gen1217#: The 'Rating' field, allows you to enter a rating, displayed in the form of stars.
#ext-gen1231#: The 'Text' field allows you to enter a short text, without advanced formatting.It integrates several validation rules: url, alphabetical, alphanumeric, e-mail or regular expression.
#ext-gen1247#: The 'Rich text' field allows you to enter rich text, using a wysiwyg editor. The component used by default is CKEditor, with three default configurations: basic, standard or full.
#ext-gen1261#: The 'Text area' field allows you to enter a long text without advanced formatting.It integrates several validation rules: alphabetical or alphanumeric.
